prior.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation
prior.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
Some prior experience with the software is needed.
prior.translation[0].note_box[0].section: He denied that he had prior knowledge of the robbery.
A sale of the factory will need the prior approval of shareholders.
We will not disclose this information without your prior agreement.
He had no prior experience of teaching.
The prime minister was unable to attend owing to a prior engagement.
Visitors can tour the burial tombs by prior arrangement.
prior.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the man in charge of a priory
prior.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the priest next in rank to the person in charge of an abbey
prior.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a previous occasion when someone was found guilty of a crime
prior.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: coming before something is finally decided, agreed etc
prior.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Most firms requireprior approval of analysts’ personal trades before selling stock to them.
Sales are expected to be $62 million, up slightly from $60 million in the prior year.
Those calculations are based on AT&T’s average stock price prior to a shareholder meeting.
